oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Medicine chest
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Medical chest that belonged to Dr. Bailey of Early Grove, Mississippi. According to local tradition, Dr. Bailey treated both Confederate and Federal soldiers in his home during the war. Original bottles and tins are included in the chest. Some of the tins still contain herbal medicines such as quinine, arrowroot, and red bark. The chest was featured in the "Three Stars of Tennessee With a Focus on Western Tennessee" (exhibition catalog).
